Road Lighting Dist. No. 3 -- 15.0 Mills - Parish Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. 3 Proposition

Summary:  Continuation of the 15.0 mills property tax within the Road Lighting District No. 3 of the Parish of Tangipahoa, Louisiana, for a period of ten (10) years, for the purpose of providing and maintaining lighting within the District.
Race.FullText: Shall the Road Lighting District No. 3 of the Parish of Tangipahoa, Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Sections 30 and 32 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to continue to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of 15.0 mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the District (the "Tax") (an estimated $17,500 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, commencing with the tax collection for the year 2010, and annually thereafter, to and including the tax collection for the year 2019, and shall the proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) be used for the purpose of providing and maintaining electric lighting on the streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places within the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Road Lighting Dist. No. 6 -- 10 Mills - Parish Council - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Road Lighting District No. 6 Proposition

Summary:  Levy and collection of a ten (10.00) mills, ten (10) year property tax by the Road Lighting District No. 6 of the Parish of Tangipahoa for the purpose of providing funds to acquire, improve and equip the system of road lighting on the streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places of the Road Lighting District No. 6 of the Parish of Tangipahoa, and to pay the operation and maintenance costs and expenses in connection therewith.
Race.FullText: Shall the Road Lighting District No. 6 of the Parish of Tangipahoa (the "Road Lighting District No. 6"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 30 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended, Chapter 7 of Title 48 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority supplemental thereto, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, of a special ad valorem tax of ten (10.00) mills on the dollar of assessed valuation on all property subject to taxation within the boundaries of the Road Lighting District No. 6 (the "Tax") (an estimated $245,000 is reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the tax collection for the year 2009, and annually thereafter to and including the year 2018, the proceeds of said Tax to provide funds to the Road Lighting District No. 6 to be used entirely and exclusively to acquire, improve and equip the system of road lighting on the streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places of the Road Lighting District No. 6, and to provide funds to pay the operation and maintenance costs and expenses in connection therewith?
